city.name: Zhangjiajie
city.parkDescr: This park is famous for its majestic pillars and rock formations. It inspired the movie "Avatar." Key attractions include: Tianzi Mountain Pillars: Remarkable rock formations offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes. Heavenly Pillar: One of the park’s most famous pillars, featuring a tall and narrow rock.
city.bridge: The Glass Bridge Over the Grand Canyon
city.bridgeDescr: Zhangjiajie is famous for its historic canals, which can be explored by boat. Canal tours offer views of traditional houses, bridges, and ancient architecture.
city.cable: Cable Car Ride to Tianmen Mountain
city.cableDescr: The world’s longest cable car ride leads to the top of Tianmen Mountain. At the summit is the "Heaven’s Gate," a rock-hewn passageway that you can walk through.
city.villageDescr: A park where you can learn about the culture and traditions of the Tujia people, including traditional houses, costumes, and crafts.
city.riverDescr: Enjoy scenic views of rivers and canyons on a ferry, passing through some of the region’s most picturesque areas.
city.forestDescr: A forest where you can walk among tall bamboo trees and enjoy the tranquility of nature.
